info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 3:42PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL SCHUYLKILL... SOUTHEASTERN NORTHUMBERLAND AND SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 341 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bloomsburg, moving south at 25 mph. Other strong storms were just south of this storm. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Bloomsburg, Pottsville, Shamokin, Mount Carmel, Shenandoah, Minersville, Frackville, Kulpmont, Ashland, Elysburg, Fairview-Ferndale, Trevorton, Catawissa, Girardville, Marshallton, Mifflinville, Almedia, Lavelle, Marlin and Altamont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
